title: Spicy Tuna Rolls Recipe
description: Even if you're new to sushi making, this recipe for fresh and spicy tuna rolls is easy to make at home.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Spicy Tuna Rolls 5.0 (1) 1 Review 3 Photos Even if you're new to sushi making, this recipe for spicy tuna rolls is easy to make at home. Submitted by ChefJackie Updated on November 10, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 30 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 sheets nori (dry seaweed) ½ pound sashimi-grade tuna, finely chopped 4 tablespoons mayonnaise 2 green onions, chopped 1 tablespoon hot chile sauce 2 ½ cups prepared sushi rice 1 tablespoon sesame seeds Directions Cut off the bottom quarter of each nori sheet; reserve for another use. Combine chopped tuna, mayonnaise, green onions, and hot sauce in a bowl. Center 1 sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat. Wet your hands. Spread a thin layer of rice on the nori using your hands; press into a thin layer, leaving a 1/2-inch space at the bottom edge. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Arrange 1/4 of the tuna mixture in a line across the rice, about 1/3 of the way down from the top of the sheet. Wet the uncovered edge of the nori. Lift the top end of the mat and firmly roll it over the ingredients. Roll it forward to make a complete roll. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Slice the rolls into 3/4-inch pieces using a wet knife. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving. Recipe Tip Adjust the amount of hot sauce you use to suit your taste. Editor's Note: Consuming raw seafood may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Add Your Photo Photos of Spicy Tuna Rolls 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  Simon 07/12/2020 This is a good recipe for beginners! The filling was a bit bland, so I would recommend adding some more flavor or maybe something to kick up the heat. 1 You’ll Also Love California Roll Sushi 79 Ratings Sarah's Special Sushi 6 Ratings Simple Tuna Fish Tacos 3 Ratings Chirashi Bowl Nigiri Sushi 7 Ratings Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll 16 Ratings Spicy Salmon Maki Ahi Sushi Cups 2 Ratings Marinated Wild Salmon 143 Ratings Lemon Sauce for Salmon Patties 240 Ratings Paper Salmon 54 Ratings Easy Brazilian Spiced Salmon 5 Ratings Dad's Candied Salmon 16 Ratings Garlic Salmon 558 Ratings Mango Salsa Salmon 108 Ratings Mediterranean-Twist Salmon 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: ChefJackie
instructions: Cut off the bottom quarter of each nori sheet; reserve for another use.;Combine chopped tuna, mayonnaise, green onions, and hot sauce in a bowl.;Center 1 sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat. Wet your hands. Spread a thin layer of rice on the nori using your hands; press into a thin layer, leaving a 1/2-inch space at the bottom edge. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Arrange 1/4 of the tuna mixture in a line across the rice, about 1/3 of the way down from the top of the sheet.;Wet the uncovered edge of the nori. Lift the top end of the mat and firmly roll it over the ingredients. Roll it forward to make a complete roll. Repeat with remaining ingredients.;Slice the rolls into 3/4-inch pieces using a wet knife. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving.
